concept.name: grid-column start and end
concept.explain:
The 'grid-column-start' property specifies on which column-line the grid item will start.
The 'grid-column-end' property specifies on which column-line the grid item will end.
The 'grid-column' property is a shorthand property for the grid-column-start and the grid-column-end properties.
Use these properties to move the car to the targeted parking spot and make it fit exactly.

ui.prompt: Move the car into the highlighted spot using grid-column, while keeping it on row 1.

entities.baseCss: background: rgba(200, 0, 0, 0.22); outline: 2px dashed rgba(200, 0, 0, 0.8); border-radius: 10px;

concept.name: grid-row start and end
concept.explain:
The 'grid-row-start' property specifies on which row-line the grid item will start.
The 'grid-row-end' property specifies on which row-line the grid item will end.
The 'grid-row' property is a shorthand property for the grid-row-start and the grid-row-end properties.
Use these properties to move the car to the targeted parking spot and make it fit exactly.

ui.prompt: Move the car vertically and make it span the full highlighted spot using grid-row.

entities.baseCss: background: rgba(200, 0, 0, 0.22); outline: 2px dashed rgba(200, 0, 0, 0.8); border-radius: 10px;

concept.name: combine grid-column and grid-row
concept.explain:
This spot is larger in both directions.
Combine 'grid-column' with 'grid-row' so the car matches the target exactly.

ui.prompt: Use both grid-column and grid-row so the car covers the entire 2×2 spot.

entities.baseCss: background: rgba(200, 0, 0, 0.22); outline: 2px dashed rgba(200, 0, 0, 0.8); border-radius: 10px;
